sentences.sentence: But the Moscow-appointed authorities there claim that there have been attacks on administrative buildings, such as this one in the city of Kherson.

sentences.sentence: administrative buildings such as this one in the city of Herson and in eastern Ukraine in Luhansk an explosion on Friday is said to have killed the separatist administration's top prosecutor Sergey gorenko and his deputy Moscow has called it a terrorist act from Uzbekistan Russian president Vladimir Putin has tried to reassure allies that everything is still under control despite the damage caused by these attacks our offensive operations in Donbass have not stopped they keep going at a slow pace but the Russian Federation is progressively gradually occupying new territories I want to draw your attention to the fact that we're not fighting with the entire Russian army, only with specific parts of the Russian army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Of course, this is linked to the parameters of our military, so therefore we're in no hurry concerning this aspect.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The Ukrainian government has also published its own footage showing abandoned Russian weapons in the Donbass and Ukrainian tanks advancing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: By 101 votes to 7, UN member states have agreed to allow Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky to address next week's General Assembly by video, a sign of Russian isolation following the discovery of possible war crimes in Izyum.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Today the world must see what the Russian army left behind, said Zelensky in his evening address, another mass burial of murdered people.

sentences.sentence: Entire families are buried there, mother, father and daughter.

sentences.sentence: The head of European diplomacy, Joseph Borre, tweeted that Russia's leadership will be held accountable. The U.S. has taken the same line.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Reports that we're seeing just in general are more than 440 graves, which reportedly includes civilians.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it's horrifying.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: While the causes of death are still being investigated, eyewitness reports say many of those buried had their hands tied and many others showed signs of torture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A day after the president of Kyrgyzstan met with his Tajik counterpart and agreed to a ceasefire at the Shanghai Cooperation Organization summit in Uzbekistan, both sides have resumed armed clashes at their disputed shared border.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This comes as fighting which broke out on Wednesday intensified on Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The last major conflict on the Kyrgyz-Tajik border was in 2021 and claimed the lives of 205 people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While security chiefs from both countries have sat down overnight for fresh talks, their governments are trading blame for renewed shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Kyrgyz border authorities say at least 24 people have been killed, 121 injured and 136,000 residents have been evacuated from border areas. While so far, Tajikistan has reported seven deaths and 14 injuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: So far this cyclonic season, seven named storms have formed in the Atlantic basin, two of which, Danielle and Earl, have reached hurricane status.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: For mourners wanting to pay their last respects to Britain's Queen Elizabeth II, the waiting time to see the royal coffin in London's Westminster Hall is now 24 hours and there's an autumn chill in the air. But that's not putting off the crowds from coming.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And when they were talking of the queues being 30 hours long, I would still have done it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It's true that it's a long wait, we've been here since 1am, but it's worth it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: For local residents, the 15km queue along the south bank of the Thames has in itself become something of a spectacle. Watching the people go by, thinking how amazing they are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Dozens of Benin bronze sculptures are going on display one last time in Berlin's new Humboldt Museum before being repatriated to Nigeria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Stolen during the colonial era from the African Kingdom of Benin, the move is part of the country's gradual reckoning with crimes committed by the former German Empire, including the genocide orchestrated by Germany in Namibia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: This object represented our ancestors, our fathers. So now that it's going to be brought back to the kingdom, it's going to fill the vacuums that were left for thousands of years backwards.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While this exhibition has been described as the country's most important cultural project, Germany has faced criticism in recent years over the origin of many artifacts in its museums.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The general director of the Humboldt Forum says, we have learned that restitution is much more than an administrative act, but a shared intercultural and at best a productive process of negotiation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And that is about personal preferences, about self-empowerment, about cultural identity and about dignity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And we have learned to listen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: You talk, we listen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Humboldt Forum was opened to the public on Saturday following a ceremony.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Berlin currently holds 530 items taken from the Kingdom of Benin, but some sculptures will be kept on loan and for research purposes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: After a two-year hiatus, Germany's famous Oktoberfest is back.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: And knocking in the first tap to open the beer-drinking festival was the mayor of Munich, Dieter Reiter, accompanied by Markus Söder, the Bavarian minister-president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The event will run until October 3rd, but due to much anticipation, some made a mad rush to be the first in, even before the official opening.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: In previous years and before the COVID-19 pandemic, the event typically drew in around 6 million visitors a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
